page.title: 07Education in Billingshurst
page.content: Schooling is provided by a{Junior {School}for ages 5-11 and an 11-18{ {Comprehensive}for 1500 from this and other districts who are bussed in. Younger pupils concentrate on basic skills in{English,Maths}with{History {Craft and Sport}as well. Older pupils study more{Science & Technology}and boys and girls must do all subjects such as{Home Economics}regardless of sex. Public exams in up to 8 subjects such as {French & Geography}are the aim of most pupils. Less than{2%}leave without such qualifications at{16.}As many as{60%}choose to stay at school until 17 or 18 studying{vocational {courses}such as{Business Studies}or advanced exams in {Physics & Sociology {etc.}Some 16 year-olds go to college in{Crawley or Chichester}for{typing or {engineering.}About 40 pupils go to {University/Polytechnic}each year.
